result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Alleshaski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J Alleshaski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher J Alleshaski was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Alleshaski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Payment Plan Established - $25.00 bi-weekly
Defendant Christopher J Alleshaski in court with attorney John M. Matousek.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Fax Cover Sheet from Atty. John Matousek, dated November 13, 2014, re Witness List.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 2, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Christopher J Alleshaski in court with attorney John M Matousek appearing by phone.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim MM appearing by phone. 

Attorney Lambert does not object to motion to reschedule. Victim does not have objection to rescheduling. Trial to be rescheduled.
Defendant's Motion for Continuance of Trial
granting request to substitute Atty Matousek in place of Atty Nolan-Plutchak.
cover letter from Attorney Matousek
and Witness List (Plaintiff)
Jury trial - 12 person on July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Not guilty plea entered.    Bond continued

3:18 Defendant Christopher J Alleshaski in court with attorney Steve Laxton.  Elizabeth R Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Laxton moves court for sequesteration.  Atty Constable states that the officers are here to testify in separate matters.  Court notes request.

Jared Beauchamp is sworn as a witness.  Testifies to his employment with Marshfield Police Dept.  Testifies to reporting to a disturbance on 03/29/14 and contact with a Mr Meharg.  Testifies to injuries sustained by Mr Meharg and that Meharg explained he has been punched.  Testifies to contact with Bradley Luther regarding knife that Alleshaski pulled on Meharg and his description of what happened.  Testifies to prior contact with Alleshaski and identifies him in the courtroom.  

Atty Laxton cross examines the witness.  Testifies to how he got his information.  Testifies to what he knew about the injury and where he got information.  Did not see Alleshaski with knife.  Testifies that Alleshaski was injured somewhere on his face.  There was no indication that Meharg was cut by a knife.  Testifies to time and location of disturbance.  

Atty Laxton argues no probable cause in the Substantial Battery.  Court finds probable cause and proceeds to ARGN.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on May 27, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
from Atty Matousek
to Appear and Act
from Matousek & Laxton Law Offices, dated April 15, 2014, re Notice of Retainer and Authorization to Appear.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

1:18 Defendant Christopher J Alleshaski in court.  Craig Steven Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alleshaski informs the court that Atty Nolan-Plutchak has been appointed as her Public Defender.  Court will proceed with Preliminary Hrg.  

Alleshaski asks court if he can waive the time limits for the Prelim Hrg today and set out for 20 days.  Court accepts the waiver of time limits and will set the matter later for Preliminary Hrg.  Court advises Alleshaski to make sure he is represented by the Public Defenders Office.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on April 8, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
